intro: Calendula lanzae, commonly known as the Lanzan marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Calendula lanzae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
